misr_init.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include "misrproj.h"          /* Prototype for this function */
00002 #include "errormacros.h"       /* Error macros */
00003 
00004 int nb;
00005 int nl;
00006 int ns;
00007 float absOffset[NBLOCK]; 
00008 float relOffset[NBLOCK-1]; 
00009 double ulc[2];
00010 double lrc[2];
00011 double sx;
00012 double sy;
00013 double xc;
00014 double yc;
00015 
00016 #define FUNC_NAMEm "misr_init"
00017 
00018 int misr_init(
00019 const int      nblock,         /* Number of blocks */
00020 const int          nline,          /* Number of lines in a block */
00021 const int          nsample,        /* Number of samples in a block */
00022 const float    relOff[NOFFSET],/* Block offsets */
00023 const double       ulc_coord[],    /* Upper left corner coord. in meters */
00024 const double       lrc_coord[]     /* Lower right corner coord. in meters */
00025 )
00026 {
00027   int          i;          /* Offset index */
00028   char         msg[STRLEN];    /* Warning message */
00029 
00030 /* Argument checks */
00031 
00032   if (nblock < 1 || nblock > NBLOCK) {
00033     sprintf(msg,"nblock is out of range (1 < %d < %d)", nblock, NBLOCK);
00034     WRN_LOG_JUMP(msg);
00035   }
00036 
00037 /* Convert relative offsets to absolute offsets */
00038 
00039   absOffset[0] = 0.0;
00040   for (i = 1; i < NBLOCK; i++) {
00041     absOffset[i] = absOffset[i-1] + relOff[i-1];
00042     relOffset[i-1] = relOff[i-1];
00043   }
00044 
00045 /* Set ulc and lrc SOM coordinates */
00046 /* Note; ulc y and lrc y are reversed in the structural metadata. */
00047 
00048   ulc[0] = ulc_coord[0];
00049   ulc[1] = lrc_coord[1];
00050   lrc[0] = lrc_coord[0];
00051   lrc[1] = ulc_coord[1];
00052 
00053 /* Set number of blocks, lines and samples */
00054 
00055   nb = nblock;
00056   nl = nline;
00057   ns = nsample;
00058 
00059 /* Compute pixel size in ulc/lrc units (meters) */
00060 
00061   sx = (lrc[0] - ulc[0]) / nl;
00062   sy = (lrc[1] - ulc[1]) / ns;
00063 
00064 /* Adjust ulc to be in the center of the pixel */
00065 
00066   xc = ulc[0] + sx / 2.0;
00067   yc = ulc[1] + sy / 2.0;
00068 
00069   return(0);
00070 
00071  ERROR_HANDLE:
00072   return(1);
00073 }
